comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: nla.gov.au/nla.news-article73689494 Ha! Can't work out how I missed this one the first few times around...with these Hall portraits it's probably a mistake to limit your searches to Sydney newspapers...if these are publicity shots (and I suspect quite a few of them are), then the pics could turn up anywhere. nla.gov.au/nla.news-article51198563 another pic of Vernon Sellars nla.gov.au/nla.news-article76399670 and a nice pic of Patsie/Patsy Hill!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] We bow down to your Flickr greatness - this is amazing! The first Hall portrait cracked! Here's another image of Mr Sellars. Turns out he also performed with this lady in 1932:

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] These other pics are nice too!

Until a few hours ago, I'd forgotten that the Sydney Bulletin included pics and cartoons of stage artists in its weekly theatre column...that might be a good place to look next...

PS...what's this Flickr greatness stuff? Gawdy! I don't have a TV and I kind of like trawling thru the old newspapers...that's the extent of my greatness...I just get a bit hooked on gazing across the years at people who once lived on planet Earth...wondering who they were...what their lives were like...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] We're so glad you remembered! And goes a way to confirming our suspicions that the Hall portraits are of performers.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
